simplesect.para: This function can be used to compute multi-part CRCs.

Size of the data

memberdef.name: Calculate

briefdescription.para: Appends additional data to a previous CRC calculation using a lookup table.

simplesect.para: This function can be used to compute multi-part CRCs.

parameterdescription.para: Data over which CRC will be computed
Size of the data
CRC lookup table
CRC from a previous calculation
Integer type for storing the CRC result
Number of bits in the CRC

briefdescription.para: Returns a set of parameters for CRC-8 SMBus.

simplesect.para: The parameters are static and are delayed-constructed to reduce memory footprint.

CRC-8 SMBus has the following parameters and check value:
polynomial = 0x07
initial value = 0x00
final XOR = 0x00
reflect input = false
reflect output = false
check value = 0xF4
CRC-8 SMBus parameters

briefdescription.para: Returns a set of parameters for CRC-16 ARC (aka CRC-16 IBM, CRC-16 LHA).

simplesect.para: The parameters are static and are delayed-constructed to reduce memory footprint.

CRC-16 ARC has the following parameters and check value:
polynomial = 0x8005
initial value = 0x0000
final XOR = 0x0000
reflect input = true
reflect output = true
check value = 0xBB3D
CRC-16 ARC parameters

briefdescription.para: Returns a set of parameters for CRC-16 BUYPASS (aka CRC-16 VERIFONE, CRC-16 UMTS).

simplesect.para: The parameters are static and are delayed-constructed to reduce memory footprint.

CRC-16 BUYPASS has the following parameters and check value:
polynomial = 0x8005
initial value = 0x0000
final XOR = 0x0000
reflect input = false
reflect output = false
check value = 0xFEE8
CRC-16 BUYPASS parameters

briefdescription.para: Returns a set of parameters for CRC-16 CCITT FALSE.

simplesect.para: The parameters are static and are delayed-constructed to reduce memory footprint.

CRC-16 CCITT FALSE has the following parameters and check value:
polynomial = 0x1021
initial value = 0xFFFF
final XOR = 0x0000
reflect input = false
reflect output = false
check value = 0x29B1
CRC-16 CCITT FALSE parameters

briefdescription.para: Returns a set of parameters for CRC-16 GENIBUS (aka CRC-16 EPC, CRC-16 I-CODE, CRC-16 DARC).

simplesect.para: The parameters are static and are delayed-constructed to reduce memory footprint.

CRC-16 GENIBUS has the following parameters and check value:
polynomial = 0x1021
initial value = 0xFFFF
final XOR = 0xFFFF
reflect input = false
reflect output = false
check value = 0xD64E
CRC-16 GENIBUS parameters

briefdescription.para: Returns a set of parameters for CRC-16 KERMIT (aka CRC-16 CCITT, CRC-16 CCITT-TRUE).

simplesect.para: The parameters are static and are delayed-constructed to reduce memory footprint.

CRC-16 KERMIT has the following parameters and check value:
polynomial = 0x1021
initial value = 0x0000
final XOR = 0x0000
reflect input = true
reflect output = true
check value = 0x2189
CRC-16 KERMIT parameters

CRC-16 X-25 has the following parameters and check value:

initial value = 0xFFFF
final XOR = 0xFFFF
reflect input = true
reflect output = true
check value = 0x906E

briefdescription.para: Returns a set of parameters for CRC-32 (aka CRC-32 ADCCP, CRC-32 PKZip).

simplesect.para: The parameters are static and are delayed-constructed to reduce memory footprint.

CRC-32 has the following parameters and check value:
polynomial = 0x04C11DB7
initial value = 0xFFFFFFFF
final XOR = 0xFFFFFFFF
reflect input = true
reflect output = true
check value = 0xCBF43926
CRC-32 parameters

briefdescription.para: Returns a set of parameters for CRC-32 BZIP2 (aka CRC-32 AAL5, CRC-32 DECT-B, CRC-32 B-CRC).

CRC-32 BZIP2 has the following parameters and check value:

initial value = 0xFFFFFFFF
final XOR = 0xFFFFFFFF
reflect input = false
reflect output = false
check value = 0xFC891918

initial value = 0xFFFFFFFF
final XOR = 0x00000000
reflect input = false
reflect output = false
check value = 0x0376E6E7

briefdescription.para: Reflects (i.e. reverses the bits within) an integer value.

parameterdescription.para: Value to reflect
Number of bits in the integer which will be reflected
Integer type of the value being reflected

simplesect.para: Reflected value

briefdescription.para: Computes the final reflection and XOR of a CRC remainder.

parameterdescription.para: CRC remainder to reflect and XOR
Final value to XOR with the remainder
true to reflect each byte of the remainder before the XOR
Integer type for storing the CRC result
Number of bits in the CRC

simplesect.para: Final CRC

briefdescription.para: Undoes the process of computing the final reflection and XOR of a CRC remainder.

parameterdescription.para: Reflected and XORed CRC
Final value XORed with the remainder
true if the remainder is to be reflected
Integer type for storing the CRC result
Number of bits in the CRC

simplesect.para: Un-finalized CRC remainder

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *data, crcpp_size size, const Parameters< CRCType, CRCWidth > &parameters, CRCType remainder)
memberdef.name: CalculateRemainder

briefdescription.para: Computes a CRC remainder.

parameterdescription.para: Data over which the remainder will be computed
Size of the data
CRC parameters
Running CRC remainder. Can be an initial value or the result of a previous CRC remainder calculation.
Integer type for storing the CRC result
Number of bits in the CRC

simplesect.para: CRC remainder

memberdef.argsstring: (const void *data, crcpp_size size, const Table< CRCType, CRCWidth > &lookupTable, CRCType remainder)
memberdef.name: CalculateRemainder

briefdescription.para: Computes a CRC remainder using lookup table.

parameterdescription.para: Data over which the remainder will be computed
Size of the data
CRC lookup table
Running CRC remainder. Can be an initial value or the result of a previous CRC remainder calculation.
Integer type for storing the CRC result
Number of bits in the CRC

simplesect.para: CRC remainder

briefdescription.para: Static class for computing CRCs.

simplesect.para: This class supports computation of full and multi-part CRCs, using a bit-by-bit algorithm or a byte-by-byte lookup table. The CRCs are calculated using as many optimizations as is reasonable. If compiling with C++11, the constexpr keyword is used liberally so that many calculations are performed at compile-time instead of at runtime.
